qas.question: What is the power-to-weight ratio of a steam plant compared to that of an internal combustion engine?
Along with internal combustion engines, what machines have superseded steam in some areas?

answers.text: internal combustion engines or electric motors

qas.question: What plants create most electric power?
What is the name of the movement that seeks renewed use of steam power in the modern era?
Along with fuel sources, what concern has contributed to the development of the Advanced Steam movement?
What is the power-to-weight ratio of a steam plant compared to that of a steam engine?
Along with internal combustion engines, what machines have superseded power in some areas?
What plants create most combustion power?

Along with fuel sources, what concern has contributed to the development of the combustion movement?

context: The weight of boilers and condensers generally makes the power-to-weight ratio of a steam plant <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><b5_0>lower<b5_0/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> than for internal combustion engines. For mobile applications steam has been largely superseded by <a1_2>internal combustion engines or <a1_0><a1_1><a1_3><b6_0>electric motors<b6_0/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>. However, most electric power is generated using <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><b7_0>steam turbine<b7_0/><a2_1/><a2_0/> plant<a2_3/><a2_2/>, so that indirectly the world's industry is still dependent on steam power. Recent concerns about fuel sources and <a4_0><a4_1><a4_3><b9_0>pollution<b9_0/><a4_3/><a4_1/><a4_0/> have incited a renewed interest in steam both as a component of <a3_2>cogeneration processes<a3_2/> and as a prime mover. This is becoming known as the <a3_0><a3_1><a3_3><a4_2><b8_0>Advanced Steam<b8_0/><a3_0/> movement<a4_2/><a3_3/><a3_1/>.[citation needed]
